intro: Othonna diversifolia, commonly known as the variable othonna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often lobed or toothed, and its clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its drought tolerance. Othonna diversifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and resilience.
